title: How to Make Nuka Cola Caps from Fallout

steps.headline: Collect some bottle caps.
steps.description: Old, battered bottle caps work best.

steps.headline: Clean the caps.
steps.description: Give them a good rinse before you use them.

steps.headline: Give them some damage.
steps.description: In the game, the caps are over two centuries old; they aren't going to be pristine. Take a hammer and put a few dents on the edges and surfaces.

steps.headline: Take a stainless steel scrubber and run it all over the cap.
steps.description: Give it a good amount of scratches.

steps.headline: Google "Nuka Cola cap template" online.
steps.description: A fair amount of results should show up. Print off a sheet of cap images.

steps.headline: Cut out the cap images.
steps.description: Cut slowly and carefully, making sure to cut in perfect circles.

steps.headline: Take some transparent glue.
steps.description: Apply a light amount of glue to the backs of the cap images. Stick them onto the tops of the caps.

steps.headline: Press down on them firmly.
steps.description: They should go all the way on the cap, with no gaps.

steps.headline: Wait for the caps to dry.
steps.description: Once they are, lightly scratch at the tops of the caps. Lightly, now. You want to give the paper that scratched look, but you don't want to tear it.

steps.headline: You are done!
steps.description: You now have a stack of Nuka Cola caps. Don't spend it all in one place!
